channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Grayson Murray, a 2-time PGA Tour winner, dies at 30
item.description: Murray pulled out of the Charles Schwab Challenge in Fort Worth a day before his death. No cause of death was given. He spoke openly about his battle with mental health and excessive alcohol use.
item.content:encoded:
Murray pulled out of the Charles Schwab Challenge in Fort Worth a day before his death. No cause of death was given. He spoke openly about his battle with mental health and excessive alcohol use.

(Image credit: Matt York)
item.dc:creator: Emma Bowman

item.title: Disney composer Richard M. Sherman has died at 95
item.description: Sherman and his brother Robert became Disney Studios' first ever in-house songwriters. They won two Oscars for their songs and score to Mary Poppins and composed the classic "It's a Small World."
item.content:encoded:
Sherman and his brother Robert became Disney Studios' first ever in-house songwriters. They won two Oscars for their songs and score to Mary Poppins and composed the classic "It's a Small World."

(Image credit: Alberto E. Rodriguez)
item.dc:creator: Jeff Lunden

item.title: 'Anora' wins Palme d'Or at the 77th Cannes Film Festival
item.description: Sean Baker's dramedy starring Mikey Madison won the annual film festival's top honor.
item.content:encoded:
Anora, during the awards ceremony of the 77th international film festival in Cannes, southern France, on Saturday.'/>

Sean Baker's dramedy starring Mikey Madison won the annual film festival's top honor.

(Image credit: Andreea Alexandru)
item.dc:creator: Chloe Veltman

item.title: U.S. Army aid vessels become unmoored near floating Gaza pier
item.description: Rough seas drove two vessels to beach in Israel and two others to anchor on a Gaza beach. Israeli forces are assisting recovery operations near the pier, U.S. officials said. There were no injuries.
item.content:encoded:
Rough seas drove two vessels to beach in Israel and two others to anchor on a Gaza beach. Israeli forces are assisting recovery operations near the pier, U.S. officials said. There were no injuries.

(Image credit: Abdel Kareem Hana)
item.dc:creator: Emma Bowman

item.title: During West Point commencement speech, Biden applauds U.S. military role abroad
item.description: President Biden delivered his first commencement speech as commander-in-chief to the U.S. Military Academy at West Point. There, he did not shy away from discussing the growing conflict in Europe and the Middle East.
item.content:encoded:
President Biden delivered his first commencement speech as commander-in-chief to the U.S. Military Academy at West Point. There, he did not shy away from discussing the growing conflict in Europe and the Middle East.

(Image credit: Spencer Platt)
item.dc:creator: Juliana Kim

item.title: New rules are in the works about abortion bans in Texas. Almost nobody's happy.
item.description: The Texas Medical Board has drafted guidelines for doctors to decide when an abortion is necessary and legal under the state's strict ban. The rules were widely panned at a recent public hearing.
item.content:encoded:
The Texas Medical Board has drafted guidelines for doctors to decide when an abortion is necessary and legal under the state's strict ban. The rules were widely panned at a recent public hearing.

(Image credit: Suzanne Cordiero)
item.dc:creator: Selena Simmons-Duffin

item.title: In Georgia, Bidenâ€™s coalition has frayed since his narrow win in 2020
item.description: President Biden eked out a win in Georgia last time, a victory that helped take him over the top in the Electoral College. But there are some warning signs it could be hard to do it again in 2024.
item.content:encoded:
President Biden eked out a win in Georgia last time, a victory that helped take him over the top in the Electoral College. But there are some warning signs it could be hard to do it again in 2024.

(Image credit: Andrew Caballero-Reynolds)
item.dc:creator: Asma Khalid

item.title: Limited testing of raw milk for bird flu leaves safety questions unanswered
item.description: An avian flu outbreak in dairy herds has stoked tensions between the federal government and raw milk advocates. Milk testing could provide assurances and useful data, but some farmers oppose it.
item.content:encoded:
An avian flu outbreak in dairy herds has stoked tensions between the federal government and raw milk advocates. Milk testing could provide assurances and useful data, but some farmers oppose it.


(Image credit: Chiara Eisner)
item.dc:creator: Pien Huang

item.title: Whatâ€™s better for the climate: A paper book, or an e-reader?
item.description: Books take a lot of resources to make. Digital readers do, too. What's the more sustainable option? The answer isn't straightforward.
item.content:encoded:
Books take a lot of resources to make. Digital readers do, too. What's the more sustainable option? The answer isn't straightforward.

(Image credit: JGI/Daniel Grill)
item.dc:creator: Chloe Veltman

item.title: Emergency convoy reaches survivors of a massive landslide in Papua New Guinea
item.description: The landslide buried a village under 20 to 25 feet of debris. More than 100 people are believed to have been killed, but officials say the number could go higher.
item.content:encoded:
The landslide buried a village under 20 to 25 feet of debris. More than 100 people are believed to have been killed, but officials say the number could go higher.

(Image credit: Benjamin Sipa/International Organization for Migration)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press
